trans-unit.target: TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_000<tab>Ever a sight for sore eyes, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. By now it's no secret, but we can't well continue our work without you.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_001<tab>As always, let us begin by taking stock of the situation. Through our previous investigation, we learned that the founders had sealed away the primal Eureka on this isle.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_002<tab>However, Ejika then came along and, acting at Eureka's behest, sabotaged the proto-aetheryte─what may be considered the beating heart of the ward. On account of which the ward has ceased to function.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_003<tab>For a blessing, we discovered a way to restore it: by infusing magicite with copious amounts of aether to create a new focal point. It took considerable time and effort, but the preparations are now ready. All that remains is to reach the primal and seal it away once more.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_004<tab>In order to do that, as per our original objective, we must gain entry to the Students' headquarters. However, this has been rendered complicated owing to a number of factors.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_005<tab>Aside from lying beyond impassable terrain, the structure is protected by a ward of its own─did you ever doubt it? Ordinarily, members of the Students are able to teleport inside, but the high concentration of aether we've measured makes doing so extremely dangerous. We must ascertain the conditions first, or we risk not emerging from the Lifestream.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_006<tab>So I've a mind to enter via the “back door,” as it were. Yet this method of ingress, too, isn't without its problems, but it's better to explain it out in the field.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_007<tab>...And that's where we stand. Now, before we set out, there's one last matter I'd like to attend to.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_008<tab>You see, I had tasked the expedition scholar with researching legends pertaining to Eureka. Call it a scholar's hunch, but I thought that a hint might be scrounged from amongst the tales. But come, let us see what the good scholar has dug up for us.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_010<tab>Greetings, Mistress Krile, <var 08 E905 ((Mistress)) ((Master)) /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! May I assume you have come about the legends?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_011<tab>Indeed we have. Did your efforts bear fruit?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_012<tab>They did, I'm pleased to say. First of all, it must be noted that there are several legends describing the forbidden land, Eureka.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_013<tab>Despite their many divergences, however, all are united in one detail: that Eureka was a repository for transcendent weapons hidden beneath the Crystal Tower.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_014<tab>Combining this fact with your account of Eureka's avatar forging a blade for Master Ejika, I'm led to conclude that the primal possesses the ability to create weapons.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_015<tab>Weapons forged by a primal, put in the hands of mortals... What could possibly go wrong?

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_016<tab>In <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> visions, <var 08 E905 ((Mistress)) ((Master)) /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> heard the words “exposure places the bearer's very soul at hazard,” did <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> not? I take that to mean that those who wield such weapons are at risk of becoming the primal's vessel.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_020<tab>This calls to mind Urianger's report on the Dark Divinity, Odin, and his sword Zantetsuken. The primal was not the rider, but the weapon.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_021<tab>Odin is said to have appeared during the age of the Allagan Empire. It may well be that Zantetsuken was forged by Eureka.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_030<tab>Recognizing the danger, the Allagans sealed Eureka's weapons beneath the Crystal Tower. And this gave rise to the myriad legends of a “forbidden land”...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_031<tab>Curious, though... Assuming Eureka was born of prayers, one would expect a deity the likes of Byregot to manifest. A brawny smithy working the forge.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_032<tab>Yet what we have is a primal possessed of an autonomous avatar, which goes around promising power and glory. Not the kind of entity that would arise from homespun legends. No, it feels all too purposeful. Calculated.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_033<tab>But such musings are for another time. I have some few things to prepare in order to make use of the aforementioned back door. In the meantime, would you go and pay Gerolt a visit?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_034<tab>I understand he's devised yet more ways to ease your labors. Come and find me when you're done speaking with him.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_035<tab>A moment, <var 08 E905 ((Mistress)) ((Master)) /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. There is one more matter I wish to speak with you about.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_036<tab>It pertains to the members of the Students believed trapped inside the headquarters. We've been speaking of rescue, but based on what we know, that may be an overly optimistic view.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_037<tab>The concentration of aether we've measured inside the tower is, to be blunt, not conducive to life. Certainly not over long periods. And all this time, there's been no observable movement from within.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_038<tab>Of course, the Students are knowledgeable and skilled folk, and they may have found some way to survive. But even as we cling to this hope, we should prepare ourselves for the worst.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_INV00463_000_039<tab>Forgive me for bothering you with gloomy talk. I won't keep you any longer; pray go and seek out Master Gerolt!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_040<tab>I'm sorry, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, but my preparations will take a while. Have you spoken with Gerolt yet?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_050<tab>Everything sorted with Gerolt? Excellent. Let us set out at once!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_051<tab>...Is what I'd like to say, but I'm afraid I need more time to complete my tasks.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_052<tab>Rather than standing idle at camp, though, may I suggest you acquaint yourself with the area outside? I should be able to complete my tasks meanwhile.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_053<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 51.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_060<tab>I'm sorry, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, but I need more time to complete my tasks. May I suggest you acquaint yourself with the area outside?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_061<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 51.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_070<tab>Apologies for the wait! We now have everything we need to make use of the back door. To be sure, there's still a couple of things that require doing out there.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_071<tab>First, let us head to the Central Columns. It's due south of here, at the Val River Source. I'll explain everything once we arrive.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_072<tab>Oh, and I should mention that, from this point on, I'll be delegating the bulk of my duties to the good scholar. If you ever want for guidance, she's the first person you should seek out. Without further ado, then!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_080<tab><pant> Once again, I'm reminded of this isle's dangers... <pant> And how much of a boon you are to our efforts.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_081<tab>Without the lessons of your field investigations to draw upon, I don't think I would've made it here in one piece.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_082<tab>So, the back door. It's an aetherbridge that conveys you to the tower's entrance, built for those who lack the ability to teleport.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_083<tab>It's usable only by those with special permission, and right now it's not usable at all due to the obstruction in the Lifestream.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_084<tab>In order to restore operation, we must repair the three sets of columns of the aetherbridge.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_085<tab>This requires that we seek out spots of pooled aether...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_086<tab>...And deploy these regulators to restore the flow. I would be grateful if you could assist with this task.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_087<tab>According to my readings of the nearby area, the aether has pooled in two locations along the river source, one in the north and another in the south.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_088<tab>I will search in the north, if you would do likewise in the south. You should have luck looking east of the Aetherbridge Foundation.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_090<tab>Leave this area to me and see to the south, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. You should have luck looking east of the Aetherbridge Foundation.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_100<tab>By my readings, I presume you've found and rectified the pooled aether. Excellent. With some minor adjustments, these columns will be in good order again.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_101<tab>This may take a little time, though, so sit tight for now. Or go and smite the local wildlife if you prefer. I'd certainly welcome fewer of them snapping at my heels.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_102<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 54.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_110<tab>I'm still working on the adjustments. Be patient just a little longer.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_111<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 54.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_120<tab>The adjustments are complete, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! Let's put our handiwork to the proof, shall we?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_121<tab>Yes, everything appears to be in order. Hopefully the remaining two sets of columns will prove no more difficult.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_122<tab>With that, let us make for the Western Columns. It's just south and east of Unverified Research. Right, silent as a mouse, silent as a mouse...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_130<tab>B-By the gods, but that was close... I literally saw into its gullet. Ugh, cannot unsee... <shudder>
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_131<tab>...Forgive me, I'm all right now. So, it appears there are two spots of pooled aether in this area as well.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_132<tab>Both are located in the northern reaches of the west bank. Let us split up and find them.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_140<tab><pant> Of all places for it to be... <pant> You may want to keep an eye up...

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_150<tab>There you are, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, and I see you managed to locate the other spot of pooled aether. I'll begin making my adjustments at once. As before, it may take a bit of time.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_151<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 57.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_160<tab>Apologies, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, but I'm still working on the adjustments. Feel free to wander about and cull the beasts.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_161<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 57.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_170<tab>Sorry for keeping you waiting! I've finished with my adjustments─let us see if they did the trick.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_171<tab>Good, no dramas here either. That leaves us with just the Eastern Columns.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_172<tab>As the name suggests, they're located on the eastern bank of the river. Off we go, then─and no more harrowing encounters!

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_180<tab>After all this sneaking about, I've gotten somewhat used to it. Still, I'm a long way off strolling around this island as if it were a flower garden like you do.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_181<tab>But on to business. Again, we have two spots of pooled aether to account for. One is due east of here, while the other appears to lie at the northern edge of the river bank area.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_182<tab>I'll head east if you wouldn't mind taking your search north. See you back here afterwards, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_190<tab>I appreciate your zeal, but one person's quite enough for this area. See to the other spot to the north, would you?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_200<tab>The regulator is in place? Excellent. As before, I'll need to carry out some adjustments. Pray bear with me a while.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_201<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 60.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_210<tab>I'm not done yet, I'm afraid. This being the last set of columns, I'm taking extra care to ensure nothing is amiss.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_211<tab>You may continue the Eureka expedition upon reaching elemental level 60.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_220<tab>Apologies for making you wait repeatedly. I'm pleased to say I've completed my adjustments, and with even greater care than usual. I don't even need to try to know that this will work.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_221<tab>See, what did I tell you? With all three sets of columns thus repaired, the aetherbridge should be operational again. At long last, we may enter the tower.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_222<tab>I've taken the liberty of granting you permission to use the bridge, so we may make the crossing at any time. Come, let us make our way thither.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_230<tab>This is it, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. The path to the tower lies wide open.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_231<tab>Within, we are like to encounter both Ejika and Eureka's avatar. They won't allow us to simply walk in and restore the ward, yet that is precisely what we must do. After all of our toils to reach this point, we cannot stop now. Let us go!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_240<tab>Eureka...

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_241<tab>Well, I don't think any of us expected it to be right by the entrance. I know for a fact that it wasn't here before. One can only assume it was moved from its hiding place.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_242<tab>At any rate, this saves us the trouble of a search, so I shan't complain. Now, as much as I would like to restore the ward at once, that restraint will interfere with its effects.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_243<tab>It's a safety measure that prevents Eureka from escaping, but by the same token it prevents us from acting against it.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_244<tab>I'll wager that Ejika is searching for a way to deactivate the restraint and release Eureka. Which means that we must find it first.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_245<tab>Grandfather's office adjoins this hall. If there is any information to be had, I daresay it will be there.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_250<tab>Apart from the mess, it's pretty much as it was. I can almost see Grandfather sitting at his desk.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_251<tab>Hmmm, if Ejika had been here, he is long gone. What could that boy possibly be up to...?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_252<tab>Well, never mind him for now. Come, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, help me look for information on the restraint.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_260<tab>Hardly surprising, but there's no “Eureka” section. We must dig a little deeper.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_270<tab>Found something, did you? Excellent, so did I. A wealth of information inside an unassuming tome.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_271<tab>Grandfather describes the ward the founders raised, the contrivances they employed to keep Eureka hidden, and─most pertinently─instructions on deactivating the restraint.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_272<tab>He also writes in detail about Eureka's avatar. Contrary to what we first assumed, the entity appears to be more akin to an instrument. 'Tis Eureka's means of manipulating aether, without which the primal cannot forge its weapons.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_273<tab>So long as Eureka itself exists, the instrument can be recreated over and over again, but it will disappear if we sever the aetheric connection between them. This we can accomplish by restoring the ward and sealing Eureka away.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_274<tab>While it falls short of outright eliminating the primal, it presents an effective way to keep it in check. I wonder, perhaps Ejika is...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_275<tab>Well, all will come to light in due course. That is all from me. Let's hear what you have learned.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_276<tab>I see... Yes, I remember. On that fateful day, Grandfather gave the order for immediate evacuation.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_277<tab>But when I attempted to teleport away, the magick failed owing to an unnatural surge in the Lifestream. So I turned my steps towards Port Surgate to find a boat.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_278<tab>I never got there, of course. I was swallowed up by the Lifestream.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_279<tab>Judging by the state of the headquarters, the others too were pulled into that raging torrent. But there was no divine intercession for them.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_280<tab>I had braced for this. From the beginning, I had resigned myself to being the sole survivor. But to now be confronted with the truth...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_281<tab>Confound it all! Aaahhhhhh!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_282<tab>Right. There'll be time for tears later. We have work to do, and Grandfather would expect us to do it.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_283<tab>Come, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Let us deactivate the restraint.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_290<tab>This, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. According to Grandfather's notes, this little thing is the crux of the restraint. Apparently, it shares a history with Eureka...but such details aren't relevant at the moment.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_291<tab>What matters is it allows us to release the restraint. Here I go.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_480<tab>That did the trick. Let us return to the hall.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_481<tab>Of course they would choose this moment to appear.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAPERSON_000_482<tab>(-Eureka-)Our enemy standeth before us, bearing light most vile. Strike <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var> down, my champion.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_483<tab>Aye, I was waiting for you to lift the restraint, as I knew you would.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_484<tab>Ejika, please! Come to your senses!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_485<tab>Come to my senses? My dear Krile, I never took leave of them. Come, we settle this now─the task that Master Galuf entrusted to us!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_486<tab>Adventurer, the blessing of Light shields you from the primal's influence! Take the sword, and strike down the avatar!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAPERSON_000_487<tab>(-Eureka-)Thou wouldst betray me? Wicked mortal!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_488<tab>Wicked, you say? Yours is the existence that threatens the world, primal. My conscience is quite clear.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_489<tab>Before making wise retorts to the primal, perhaps you would care to explain...well, everything?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_490<tab>What is there to explain? I acquired the weapon needed to defeat Eureka's avatar and set up an ambush. Isn't it obvious?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_491<tab>I thought that you would be able to deduce my plan of winning the enemy's confidence, but it seems I overestimated you.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_492<tab><sigh> That's our Ejika. All's well that ends well.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_492<tab>Ahem. Aren't we celebrating a little early?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_493<tab>...Yes, our Ejika indeed. My apologies. I'll restore the ward at once.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_494<tab>No, Krile. That is not what we need to do.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGD_000_500<tab>I'm against sealing it. If it's possible to slay Eureka, that is what we must do.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGG_000_501<tab>(-Galuf-)In the absence of an avatar, its master might command it to forge more weapons than the aether it harbors. This is true.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGK_000_502<tab>And without the means to replenish its aether, it will eventually consume itself.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGZ_000_503<tab>This will not work, my friends. Surely you see the flaw in this method.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGD_000_504<tab>What, that master and eikon are one and the same? That our aether would be Eureka's aether? Aye, we know this, but we've got a responsibility.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGG_000_505<tab>(-Galuf-)As those who unearthed the being... If my life can set things to rights, gladly would I render it up. Yet therein lies the problem.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGZ_000_506<tab>Eureka harbors tremendous aether. Far more than the four of us combined. We would all perish long before we succeed.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EUREKAYOUNGK_000_507<tab>...Well, my friends, it seems we have no choice at all.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_510<tab>Let me guess: you had another vision?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_511<tab>How very timely. And now you know what I seek to do.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_512<tab>Now, wait here! What exactly <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> you planning to do?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_513<tab>Hmph, how many times must you make me state the obvious?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_514<tab>Master Galuf conceived of a way to destroy Eureka, and I mean to carry it out.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_515<tab>Out of the question! If the four founders together couldn't do this, what makes you think you alone can?

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_516<tab>Eureka expended vast amounts of aether to bring the Isle of Val out of the Lifestream. Even accounting for what it has since recovered, my aether alone should more than suffice.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_517<tab>If that's the case, then I should be the one to do it! It's my solemn responsibility as the sole survivor of the destruction!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_518<tab>Protected by your blessing as you are, Eureka will not recognize you as its master. Only I can do this.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_519<tab>Having read Master Galuf's memo, you should know the danger the primal poses. We cannot risk it falling into Ascian hands again. Destroying it now is the ideal solution.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_520<tab>There's nothing ideal about a solution that requires you to sacrifice yourself. Besides, I didn't think a self-centered fellow like you would aspire to martyrdom!

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_521<tab>Such puerile provocation ill becomes you, Krile. And no matter what you say, you cannot deny the truth. Sealing Eureka away would only be a temporary measure. Nay, we must destroy it, here and now.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_100_521<tab>If Master Galuf believed it possible, he himself would have done the deed. And it is possible now. I have already made my peace; let me do what must be done.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_522<tab>What you seek to do, there's no undoing! It's suicide, plain and simple, and as your comrade I cannot allow it!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_100_522<tab>With Emmerololth vanquished, there's no immediate danger! While Eureka is contained, we can search for other ways to deal with it!

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_523<tab>Your assertions are all too easily refuted, but 'tis plain you have already made up your mind on the matter. The best thing to do here is to defer to a third party.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_525<tab>Adventurer. Without you, we couldn't have gotten this far. You have as much say as any of us on how we should proceed.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_526<tab>...Very well. I trust <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>'s judgment. Whatever be <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> decision, I will accept it.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_100_527<tab>There you have it. To defeat Eureka here and now, or to restore the ward and delay the inevitable... Make your choice, adventurer.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_528<tab>The story will unfold differently depending on whose approach you choose to support.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_529<tab>Once you begin upon one path, the other will no longer be available to you.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_530<tab>Please note, however, that your choice will not affect the rewards and challenges to come.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_540<tab>Admittedly, sealing Eureka away does not end it, but we shouldn't rush our decision as Ejika seems to believe we must.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_541<tab>Once the ward is operational again, we'll have ample time to consider the best course of action. Surely you agree with me?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_542<tab>Should you give your support to Krile's approach, Ejika's path will no longer be available to you.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_543<tab>Please note, however, that your choice will not affect the rewards and challenges to come.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_YESNO_001<tab>Support Krile's approach?

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_YESNO_002<tab>Are you certain you wish to support Krile's approach? <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※By proceeding, Ejika's path will no longer be available to you.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_550<tab>Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I knew we would be on the same page.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_551<tab>So, Ejika. That is two against one in favor of restoring the ward.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_552<tab>Hmph, lost your nerve, have you? I would try to impress upon you the danger of this course, but I would only be wasting my breath.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_553<tab>If it's to be the ward, then so be it. I will cooperate with you. Be thankful.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_554<tab>I'm thankful, truly I am. If you were to lend us your keen mind, I'm confident we will find a true solution.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_555<tab>Without further ado, then, I will reactivate the ward.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_560<tab>'Tis done. Eureka lies sealed again.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_561<tab>I would sooner see it destroyed, as you know, but it's at least a step in the right direction. What next?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_562<tab>We have much and more to discuss. Shall we return to camp for the time being?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_563<tab>We will go on ahead. See you anon, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_570<tab>Ah, there you are. I received word a short while ago, but both Rowena and Hancock have come to observe our efforts.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_571<tab>To spare ourselves a bit of repetition, let us wait to have our discussion in their presence.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_610<tab>So, you've done it─destroyed all of Eureka's unholy creations. Excellent work, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_611<tab>...What brings us here? In short, we have a plan.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_612<tab>An idea occurred to me at the Waking Sands, you see, and I had returned to the isle to discuss it with Ejika.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_613<tab>While promising, it was contingent upon the success of your mission. I'm pleased to see that you didn't squander my efforts to send you to the upper level.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_614<tab>So, it is as we had deduced. The weapons had gained sentience owing to their awakening as primals.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_615<tab>Tell me, adventurer. If Eureka were destroyed, what do you suppose would become of its aether?

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_616<tab>To spare you Ejika's riddling─ordinarily, it would return to the aetherial realm, but this is not the case when the weapons are near. Nay, being primals in essence, they would be quick to absorb such untethered aether.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_617<tab>Aye, and thus were the weapons an impediment to the plan.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_618<tab>I had conceived of a number of methods to defeat Eureka without the need to sacrifice my life.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_619<tab>The most promising of these involves the use of teleportation. In the moments before Eureka drains me of all my aether, I would retreat into the Lifestream to safely emerge after the primal's demise.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_620<tab>However, all it takes is one of Eureka's voracious weapons to cause the plan to go awry.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_621<tab>For even should its maker cease to exist, there is a high probability that it would consume my aether ere I can make good my escape.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_622<tab>Lest you wonder, my idea was based on Y'shtola's use of Flow to flee into the Lifestream. I put it to Ejika, but of course he had already considered it and explained to me this caveat.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_623<tab>But thanks to you, adventurer, the weapons are no more. Naught remains to hinder the execution of the plan.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_624<tab>Indeed. We may now defeat Eureka while ensuring Ejika's safety. I shall stand at the ready to deal with the unforeseen.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_625<tab>Well, I suppose your assistance would be better than none at all. I'm in your hands, Krile.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_630<tab>Whew... Though the risk was small, I couldn't help but feel nervous.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_631<tab>On that, we are in agreement. I must say I'm a little tired.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_632<tab>Let us return to camp, then. I daresay you've earned a good rest.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_633<tab>We will go on ahead. Come and see us after you've made your own way back.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_640<tab>'Twas a long and arduous road, for you not least of all, but we finally did it. We defeated Eureka.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_641<tab>If truth be told, I did not expect that you could rally so many comrades and destroy all of the weapons.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_642<tab>You are a paragon of your kind, adventurer. Should the opportunity arise, I shall look forward to depending on you again.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_643<tab>Well, I do not rightly recall a time when Ejika admitted to depending on anyone. You may consider that an honor, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_644<tab>Now then, as much as I'd like to linger and savor our success, I do have other responsibilities. I shall be on my way. Thank you, my friend, for everything.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_645<tab>Take care, Ejika.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_646<tab>...You too, Krile.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_647<tab>Allow me to thank you as well. None of this would have been possible without you. Should your path ever lead you back to this isle, know that you will always be welcome here.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_650<tab>Ah, there you are. I received word a short while ago, but our financiers have come to observe our efforts.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_651<tab>I had reported that our mission was close to completion, and it seems they wished to see things with their own eyes.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_HANCOCK_000_660<tab>My friends, I am heartened to see you hale and whole! By this, may I assume that business is indeed concluded here?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_ROWENA_000_661<tab>We've read the report. Tell us what happened after.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_662<tab>...And that's how it unfolded, Ejika sacrificing his own life to defeat Eureka.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_HANCOCK_000_663<tab>By the kami, such a brave and selfless act... He will not soon be forgotten.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_ROWENA_000_664<tab>So, what now? This did turn out to be your isle, after all.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_665<tab>There's considerable cleaning up to be done, retrieving all the research material and the like. For this task, I will request that a team be dispatched from the Sharlayan motherland.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_666<tab>We would be grateful if your two concerns could provide support to said Sharlayan contingent. In return, the Students shall grant you the rights to use the isle for your trading activities.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_HANCOCK_000_667<tab>We will need to draw up the details of the agreement, but I see no reason why we would reject your proposal. On a personal note─what of yourself, Mistress Krile? What do you intend to do next?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_668<tab>Myself? Hmmm...
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_669<tab>I will rejoin the Scions. My presence is no longer required here. Rest assured I will make the necessary arrangements with my countrymen.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_HANCOCK_000_670<tab>I see. In that case, perhaps it would be best to save discussing the finer points for afterwards. In the meantime, would you mind if the expedition continues with its work?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_671<tab>Not at all. Be my guest.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_ROWENA_000_672<tab>That's all for now, then. We'll be in touch again come negotiation time.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_673<tab>Well, we should be getting back to our duties as Scions. We mustn't let grief halt our steps, lest a certain someone smirk at us from beyond.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_674<tab>Come, my friend. Let's carry on─for Ejika.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_SYSTEM_000_675<tab>You may now ride mounts within Eureka Hydatos!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_680<tab>So, you've done it─destroyed all of Eureka's unholy creations. Excellent work, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_681<tab>...What brings me back to the isle? In short, I have a plan. One that required the success of your mission.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_682<tab>That you were on a foray to the upper level when I arrived was opportune, and I decided to seek you out.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_683<tab>As you know, when a primal is vanquished, its aether is given back to the aetherial realm. However, I believe this was not the case with Eureka, owing to the nearby presence of its weapons.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_684<tab>Having become primals in essence, the weapons would have been quick to absorb such untethered aether.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_685<tab>This fact gave me hope, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>─hope that Ejika may still live.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_686<tab>You see, when Ejika set about destroying Eureka, he didn't have the air of a person going to his death. I couldn't shake the feeling that he was planning something. Thus did I decide to see where the trail of his aetheric essence led.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_687<tab>And what should I find but evidence that he had used a teleportation magick. I believe he intended to escape into the Lifestream before Eureka drained him of all his aether.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_688<tab>The idea was that he would reappear after the primal's demise. Yet he never did, and it's highly likely that his aether was caught in the tenacious pull of Eureka's weapons.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_689<tab>But thanks to you, the weapons are no more. There is a chance that we may pluck Ejika out of the aether─as the Elder Seedseer once did for Y'shtola.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_690<tab>To that end, I went to Gridania to learn this technique. And I mean to put it to the proof right now.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_691<tab>Without further ado, then. Wish me luck!
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_700<tab>Let me guess: the adventurer destroyed Eureka's weapons, then you pulled me out of the aether.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_701<tab>That's...precisely what we did. Don't tell me you had anticipated this too?

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_702<tab>That's too much credit even for me. As accomplished as <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> is, I did not count on the adventurer defeating all the weapons. And it was highly unlikely that my aether could be reformed.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_703<tab>There was a sliver of a chance that I would survive, but the fact is I was prepared for the worst.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_704<tab>You saved my life. And for that, I thank you.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_705<tab>An unbegrudging show of gratitude from you? Well now, strange things do happen.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_706<tab>Ejika is doubtless tired. I will accompany him back to camp and see that he gets some rest. Come and join us later.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_710<tab>'Twas a long and arduous road, for you not least of all, but we were able to rescue Ejika. Permit me to thank you as well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_711<tab>So, I've heard what took place in my absence, but what now for the two of you?
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_712<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> and I both have our duties, and we shall return to them.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_713<tab>In that case, you may leave the isle's outstanding affairs to me. I had considered myself a dead man; the least I can do is tend to the aftermath.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_714<tab>Thank you. It's reassuring to know that the isle is in your care.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_715<tab>I shall be on my way, then. Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, for everything.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_KRILE_000_716<tab>Take care, Ejika.
TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_717<tab>...You too, Krile.

TEXT_CTSERKEUREKA4KRILE_00545_EJIKATSUNJIKA_000_718<tab>Allow me to thank you again. Among other things, I wouldn't be standing here were it not for you. Should your path ever lead you back to this isle, know that you will always be welcome here.
